00025 typedef struct{
00026         int i;   number of "wrong" synonyms -- can't be more than 20

00035 typedef struct {
00036         char typ[100]; /* type of line -- padded for extra info.  Also
00037                         used for line rule designations. */
00038         int f; /* number of fields */
00039         /* Since the length of any one line is 80 characters, there can be,
00040         *         at most (one hopes) 80 fields.  */
00041         int c[80]; /* number of characters in field */
00042         /*fieldinfo fi[80];  change information for each field */
00043         int i; /* toggle -- 0 for no change information, 1 if exists.
00044                         Others designations can be added... */
00045         char t[80]; /* type of entry for each field:
00046         integer = i
00047         character = c
00048         string = s
00049         float = f
00050         double = d
00051         */
00052 } pdb_line_info;
00053 typedef struct {
00054 /* This structure defines a pdb line.  It defines it by class as given
00055   in the pdb format instructions.  Doing it this way allows rules to be
00056   set per class -- for example, one class should be present, at most, once
00057   in any pdb file.  */
00058         pdb_line_info b[25]; /* pointer to record type -- currently, there
00059                               are 22 record types in the most populated
00060                               class of records. */ 
00061         char r[50]; /* String containing a rule for this entire set of
00062                        lines. */
00063 } pdb_line;
